instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_ON_OFF: What is SMC_ON_OFF? SMC_ONOFF tells the computer that the power button has been pressed..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: Imac 21.5 - 820 3588 - Some times turn on some times not
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

Working on imac 21.5 - 820 3588. this one came with the problem not turning one. 

I open it, removed the board and i noticed that cmos 3V was only with 1.5V. 

I replace the pile for a new one and i thought the problem was solved but after 2 days the problem remains! 

I already <SIGNAL>CLEAN_ME</SIGNAL> the original bios tried a new one but no changes! 

I already try to shunt the pads directly on board no changes to! 

If i remove and insert the cmos the machine works normal but after 1/2 days stop turning one! This machine is very unstable. Some times turn on some times not! 

already try to start in SMC bypass don't turn one to! 



has anyone had any similar problem??

threads.title: Imac 21.5 - 820 3588 - Some times turn on some times not
threads.message:
Check RTC signals level.
CMOS battery voltage drops after few days, or remains at 3V?

threads.title: Imac 21.5 - 820 3588 - Some times turn on some times not
threads.message:
Already check signals and seems ok! CMOS remains at 3V. I 


I already did a reflow on SMC, jump a wire directly J5120 (<SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF</SIGNAL>)  to J6901 (<SIGNAL>PWR_BTN_R</SIGNAL>) and same history the machine don't turn on when button is pressed! 

I've been fixing some old imacs with the similar problem replacing LTC3851. Can this problem be something like that?

thanks

threads.title: Imac 21.5 - 820 3588 - Some times turn on some times not
Imac 21.5 - 820 3588 - Some times turn on some times not
threads.message:
with my power supply connected to the board and when it don't turn on, the power supply consume 0.070A  and i have this signals: 

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_AP</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_ENET</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVDDQ_S3_DDR</SIGNAL> = 1.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVDDQ_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVDDQ_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.5V
<SIGNAL>PPDDRVTT_S0</SIGNAL> = 0V 
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.05V
<SIGNAL>PPCPUVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0V

when the machine remembered to turn on, the power supply consume only 0.010V 

and only have this signals:

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

weird problem!

threads.title: Imac 21.5 - 820 3588 - Some times turn on some times not
threads.message:
Don't confuse turned on with working state.
You board turns always on, as you get even S0 voltages.
Missing CPU VCORE for some reason.
Resolder <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7110</CHIP>/30/50 areas.

Be aware, this board uses the f***g FDMF6808 chips.
You can try changing all with NEW FDMF6708.
